intro: Hymenatherum tenuilobum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features slender, often climbing stems and bipinnate leaves with narrow, elongated leaflets. Its flowers are typically yellow or golden in color, arranged in racemes, and attract various pollinators. Hymenatherum tenuilobum is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
